frameDefinitions: A Supplier gives a Theme to a Recipient to fulfill a need or purpose (Imposed_purpose) of the Recipient.
An Agent, Actor, Entity, or Medium causes a Phenomenon to be perceived by a Perceiver.

A Cognizer produces a Target_symbol which represents, in the Target_representation format, a Content that pre-exists in the form of a Source_symbol in a Source_representation format. ''  'This word is sometimes  translated as ` girl '.
An Offerer indicates that he or she is able and willing to give a Theme to a Potential_recipient.
A Cause leads to the formation of a Created_entity.
The Creator creates a new entity, the Created_entity, possibly out of Components.
frameExamples: Habituating the ground nesting chimp groups is done by <t>provisioning</t> them with sugar cane. CNI INI
This word is sometimes <t>translated</t> as ` girl '. CNI
The host graciously <t>offered</t> us food and drink.
The Libyans were <t>generating</t> arms for export.
listRoleDefinitions: The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and causes it to be in the possession of the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object that is given to the <fen>Recipient</fen> .
The <fen>Recipient</fen>'s intended purpose for the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Supplier</fen> gives the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Agent</fen> intentionally creates a situation in which the <fen>Perceiver</fen> observes or experiences the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is an entity or idea that is perceived by the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
The <fen>Perceiver</fen> is made to have a perceptual experience by the <fen>Agent</fen>.
An <fen>Actor</fen> is a sentient being who is exhibiting, possibly uninintentionally, some <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
An object that has some association with a <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Medium</fen> through which a <fen>Phenomenon</fen> is expressed.
When the event occurs.
The location where the <fen>Agent</fen> causes the perception of the <fen>Perceiver</fen>.
This is the person who carries out the translation.
A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Source_representation</fen> format.
The representation system in which the <fen>Content</fen> pre-exists.
A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Target_representation</fen> format.
The representation system into which the <fen>Content</fen> is rendered by the <fen>Cognizer</fen>.
The information that is meant to be represented by the <fen>Source_symbol</fen> and <fen>Target_symbol</fen>.
This Frame Element marks expressions that indicate when a certain Categorization was made.
The location where the translation takes place.
The person that begins in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen> and offers it to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen> .
The entity that ends up in possession of the <fen>Theme</fen>.
The object which is offered for transfer.
The <fen>Time</fen> is when the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
The <fen>Place</fen> where the <fen>Offerer</fen> offers the <fen>Theme</fen> to the <fen>Potential_recipient</fen>.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
An animate or inanimate entity, a force, or event that produces an effect. Volitionality is not a necessary characteristic of <fen>Cause</fen>s.
The <fen>Creator</fen> creates a created entity.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
The Creator creates a created entity.
This role identifies the entity that the Agent intentionally creates.
This role identifes the Time when an Agent intentionally creates a new entity.
This role identifies the place ehere the Agent intentionally creates the new entity.
listRoleExamples: I approve of <fex>your</fex> having supplied him with a file of soldiers.
VESID also supplied <fex>him</fex> with an all zone bus pass to help him travel to interviews.

Cromwell merged men from multiple regiments into a single one and provisioned
them <fex>with red uniforms</fex> to replace their former regiment colors.
God gave them the promise of victory and equipped them <fex>for the battle</fex>.
In Breidbach, water tankers were <fex>yesterday</fex> supplied to the community as the main water supply pipe had been washed away.

The Harpley was launched in Launceston on the 2nd February, 1847, and with the exception
of her chain cables, was <fex>there</fex> supplied with all her materials and stores.

The text was published in Lescarbot's Les Muses de la Nouvelle-France (Paris
1609) and later translated <fex>by HT Richardson</fex>.
Biblical scholars typically translate <fex>kenosis</fex> as self-emptying or self-offering.
More books were translated <fex>from other languages</fex> into Russian in the 1980s , including record numbers from English , German and French.
Together with the French Prime Minister, Guizot, he translated it into French <fex>as entente cordiale</fex> for King Louis Philippe to use in his speech.
Well they translated it <fex>into Spanish</fex> as 'Uno-Dos-Tres Meneha Meneha!'
She guided me through the dishes available that afternoon and translated <fex>my order</fex> into Spanish for the older woman in the kitchen.
<fex>Last year</fex> I translated a short book on the artist Anne Ratkowski (of the pre-war November Group in Berlin) from German into English.
